event.title: lies in the southwestern corner of the county at the junction of State Highway 350 and Farm to Market Road 1606

data.event: It lies in the southwestern corner of the county at the junction of State Highway 350 and Farm to Market Road 1606, ten miles southwest of Snyder, and has an estimated population of 250.
A school opened in 1893 and Ira Green became postmaster when the community's post office was activated three years later.
A school opened in 1893 and Ira Green became postmaster when the community's post office was activated three years later.

event.title: economic downturn in Scurry County, and in 1980

data.event: After reaching its peak in the early 20th Century, Ira survived a period of economic downturn in Scurry County, and in 1980 was reportedly home to 485 residents.

event.title: had fallen by almost half by 1990

data.event: This had fallen by almost half by 1990, and in 2000 Ira reported approximately 250 residents.
